clinical_study.brief_title: Electric Acupuncture for ICU-acquired Weakness in Mechanical Ventilation Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 1 Study of Electric Acupuncture for ICU-acquired Weakness in Mechanical Ventilation Patients With Sepsis/Multiple Organ Dysfunction Syndrome

lead_sponsor.agency: Jiangsu Province Hospital of Traditional Chinese Medicine

clinical_study.source: Jiangsu Province Hospital of Traditional Chinese Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: Intensive care unit acquired weakness (ICU-AW) is common and dramatically affect recovery. The purpose of this study is to determine whether electric acupuncture therapy is effective in the treatment of ICU-AW especially in the patients receiving mechanical ventilation with sepsis or multiorgan system failure.

detailed_description.textblock: The principle of acupuncture is to produce bioelectric current, as a consequence, to invigorate the circulation, promote tissue regeneration, relieve pain, enhance the immune function, etc. And electric acupuncture can stimulate bioelectricity activities at acupoints, out of reach for ordinary acupuncture effect, especially in the fields of nerve/muscle recovery and regeneration.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed until the date of weaning from mechanical ventilation, an expected average of 8 weeks
primary_outcome.description: muscle force, arm circumference, skin fold thickness

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed until the date of weaning from mechanical ventilation, an expected average of 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: the time span from the beginning of mechanical ventilation, till the weaning of mechanical ventilation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed until the 28th day after mechanical ventilation
secondary_outcome.description: the mortality till the 28th day after mechanical ventilation

secondary_outcome.measure: number of participants with adverse events of electric acupuncture
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed until the date of weaning from mechanical ventilation, an expected average of 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: the adverse enents include fainting, infection, bleeding, viscera damage, and so on.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed until the date of discharge from the ICU, an expected average of 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: the time span from the beginning of mechanical ventilation, till the date of discharge from the ICU

arm_group.description: Electric acupuncture therapy on four limbs 30 min each time, twice per day; or conservative treatment without electric acupuncture.

intervention.description: Electric acupuncture therapy was made on LI4, LI11, ST36, and ST41 on four limbs for each patient, 30 min for each time, twice per day. Starting from the beginning of mechanical ventilation, to the weaning of the mechanical ventilation.
General treatment, without electric acupuncture, include passive range-of-motion exercise，q2H turning，minimizing the use of sedation, etc.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of sepsis or multiple organ dysfunction syndrome
- Within 48 hours from the initiation of mechanical ventilation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant patients
- Neuromuscular disease or cerebrovascular accident
- With temporary or permanent pacemaker
- Need to use neuromuscular blocking agents
- Inactivity for more than 5 days before ICU admission
